If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.23-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82538 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** fischer9966+021926+82538c@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** iPhone 16 Pro / 26.3 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Login to Expensify App with new gmail account 2. Create new workspace 3. Navigate to "Reports" and select "Expenses" in filters 4. Create a manual expense. 5. Once expense preview is not highlighted anymore, open it. 6. Close expense 7. Verify that the expense is not highlighted again 8. Create a second manual expense 9. Verify that only the newly created expense is highlighted ## Expected Result: Only the newly created expense is highlighted ## Actual Result: Only the first of several expenses created in a row is highlighted. The second and subsequent expenses are not highlighted. If user leave Reports and return, everything is repeated - only the first expense will be highlighted. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5357ae9f-06ec-40e2-b0ad-2ad2c849c1cd [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: Update date search filters to use `Start` and `End`

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C03U7DCU4/p1771519965997709


**What the problem is:**
NewDot date filters are labeled After and Before, which is unintuitive for users trying to set an inclusive date range (they may need to enter the day before the intended start date).

**What the expected output is:**
Rename the date filter labels to Start and End to match user expectations for setting a date range.

**Requirements**
Make sure this text is updated for all date filters, including the advanced search filters rhp, and the exposed filters
All we need to change in the actual query is changing the operator from using `<` and `>` to `<=` and `>=`

So `date>2025-12-01` would be come `date>=2025-12-01`

title: Start Sentry in spans in native code

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Problem
When a user opens the app, if Sentry spans don't start until JS is loaded, then we don't have visibility into how long it took the native code to initialize.

### Solution
Start Sentry from native.

## Action Performed:

3. Trigger an export error
4. Observe the displayed error message

A single, concise error message should be displayed.

## Action Performed:
1. Customer migrated to New Expensify
2. As migrated customer navigate to Workspace settings and observe Accounting and submission frequency
## Expected Result:
QuickBooks connections should remain intact after migration.
Scheduled Submit should not automatically enable without admin action.
## Actual Result:
All QuickBooks connections were disconnected from all workspaces post-migration.
Scheduled Submit was automatically enabled.
## Workaround:
Customer manually reconnected QuickBooks and disabled Scheduled Submit.

title: Sage Intacct export fails due to hidden expense missing Multi-Entity Location

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:**
**Reproducible in staging?:** (Needs Reproduction) Reproduction blocked - Unable to export due to error message
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @JamieMcElroy
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771457600004919)

## Action Performed:

1. Logs into [new.expensify.com](http://new.expensify.com/)
2. Creates or opens a report containing multiple expenses
3. Attempts to export report to Sage Intacct
4. Export fails with an error: “Failed Sage Intacct export due to a missing Multi-Entity Location”
5. Checks all visible expenses in New Expensify – all show valid Locations
6. Switches to Classic
7. Identifies hidden expense line missing Location
8. Populates missing Location in Classic
9. Re-exports report – export succeeds

## Expected Result:
All expenses, including hidden or system-generated lines, should be visible in New Expensify
Any missing required fields (like Multi-Entity Location) should be clearly indicated
Export or submission should be blocked with an actionable error message before reaching Intacct
Users should not need to switch to Classic to resolve required field issues
## Actual Result:
Export fails with Intacct error
All visible expenses in New Expensify appear valid
Hidden expense line with missing Location is not visible/editable in New Expensify
User must switch to Classic to identify and correct the missing Location
After correcting in Classic, export succeeds
## Workaround:
Unknown
## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari
